reviews.title: We had a wonderful time!
reviews.text: My husband and I were going to Key West to attend a family wedding and were looking for accommodations that were reasonably priced. The Angelina really suited our personalities and our needs! It was wonderful to spend time in a quiet atmosphere. We stayed in the "Trixie" - comfortable king sized platform bed, microwave, refrigerator, radio. We loved having no TV or phones (although we had our cellular phones)- just perfect for a restful time! The bathroom was nicely sized and included a large shower (no tub, which is OK for us), commode, vanity, large mirror, and moveable plastic cabinet. Everything in our room was spotlessly clean! Robbie took care of our rental car when we checked in, and we did not need it until we left Key West. Breakfast was minimal but fine - yummy homemade cinnamon rolls headlined the bill of fare! The pool is small but we were not there to break any Olympic time trials; Robbie told us the pool is normally shaded by palm branches; the winds from Hurricane Wilma brought down some branches so the pool was in full sun. If you don't wish to use the pool, just relax in one of the chairs or in the hammock. The pool deck is made of brick pavers, which are really easy on bare feet. One nice perk is that you can take towels from the pool area off premises to use at the beach, on a boat, whatever, just as long as they're returned. It's the first time I've visited a place that will permit their guests to do that. The Angelina is in the heart of Old Town, so you can walk anywhere! And, since it's only two blocks from Duval Street, you can enjoy the rowdy side of Key West and have some peace, too! Close enough, but far enough away! I will definitely stay at The Angelina the next time we visit Key West. Kevin, Janet, and Robbie have to be among the most hospitable folks you'll find anywhere!

reviews.title: Best value in Key West
reviews.text: We had a great 2 week stay at the Angelina. Kevin & Janet were the perfect hosts and all the staff were helpful and friendly, always there to offer advice and recommend some great trips. Danger Charter was fantastic and well worth the $75.

The Angelina is definitely a place for couples, it has a small tranquil pool area (pool towels are provided) and it is the perfect place to unwind. The gardens were tidy considering that Katrina had just passed. We stayed in room Brandy, it was clean comfortable and a decent size. We also had a fridge and microwave in the room, which came in handy with the size of American portions - a doggy bag every night.
reviews.title: Best guesthouse in Key West
Quaint Little Guest House
reviews.text: Breakfast was simple but adequate with eggs, cinamon rolls, fruit, oatmeal and toast. As much as you can eat!

reviews.title: best deal in Key West
reviews.text: The location of the Angelina is also worth mentioning, it is just 2 blocks from Duval Street where you will find all the action, but far enough away to escape the noise.

We arrived to find that our tiny room (barely enough room around the bed to place our one suitcase was facing the street and right by the entrance with a door incapable of closing quietly. And with busses, drunken revelers and the ubiquitous Harley Davidson bikes roaring by sleep was not to be found in a room with cardboard thin walls.
reviews.title: Nice, but tiny room and LOUD!

reviews.text: We were actually hoping for something of a romantic get away, which was definitely not what we were to get, so I am surprised that quite a few other travellers recommend this hotel as exactly that. Maybe the other rooms on the other side and away from the street are more agreeable. The pool area is indeed quite nice but not exactly special.
reviews.title: Relaxing oasis with great hosts

reviews.text: The hotel is two blocks away from Duval Street so you almost right where the action is (good) but not far enough to be spared the noise (in my book: bad).
reviews.title: Quintessential Key West flavor
The Angelina far exceeded my expectations !!
reviews.text: TIP: Definitely make sure you get a room facing the pool and away from the street.

We only stayed one night but would have stayed more if we had time. Went for a lovely swim in the 90 degree heated pool at midnight (they let you use it 24 hours a day). Great cinnamon rolls for breakfast, big room with a comfy bed, 3 cats for petting. The Angelina attracts a certain clientele...the other guests were friendly yet quiet and laidback. Plus when you arrive Kevin makes sure you have a parking spot so that your stay is worry free.
reviews.title: Charming place to stay

reviews.text: I must say first that for the money, and LOCATION, The Angelina outdoes itself. IT isn't exactly in the prettiest neighbourhood, but it is a very peaceful neighbourhood. AND it is just a block or 2 from the CENTER of DUVAL. IT is also very close to the Hemingway house, and lighthouse. Unfortunately, we came during a busy weekend, and the only room they had left was the small queen room right next to the front door.The room was named "DAISY" It turned out to be a GREAT room! IT is tiny, but has a big bathroom, a good dresser, mini fridge, and cute decor. The fact that it was next to the front door made it easier for us as well. Very clean, and the pool area is extremely relaxing. The only downside is the breakfast, it's pretty average. BUt hey you can go down the street and eat a feast. Plus your in KEY WEST, you won't be awake that early :)
reviews.title: GREAT BARGAIN

reviews.text: I loved the Angelina. As they say, it may not be for everyone, but I found it VERY clean, friendly and the pool was delicious. I also liked the wrap around porch for sitting and watching.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.text: My fiancé and I have stayed here on three separate occasions and have been very pleased each time. The rooms are reasonably priced, and very clean. The owner and office manager are friendly and helpful. They do not have parking, however the owner parked our car for us each time and it was never an issue. The pool area is beautiful and I love the hammock. It's only a couple blocks from Duval and only two blocks from the green parrot bar.
reviews.title: Great Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: The only thing to watch is the cheapest rooms that share a bathroom - they are very tiny. The only thing that fits in the room is a full size bed. But you get what you pay for, as the rooms are only $69 - $89. That's a bargain for such a great location and well run B&B.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B
Felt like home..
reviews.text: We absolutely loved staying at the Angelina - the room we stayed in was just what we needed, clean, simple, and inexpensive!! The guest house was full for the whole week, something other guest houses in KW seemed to have trouble doing. The owners are great and friendly and the pool is perfect to relax in or around. Would recommend this to anyone - it is a great place to stay at less than half the price of other guest houses in KW!!! We'll be back soon enough!

Please believe all the nice reviews about this place, I can't imagine there is a better bargain in Key West. The place is absolutely spotless. The bed was comfortable. The staff is helpful and friendly - ask them about renting bikes and they have them there in a snap, ask them to recommend a restaurant and they steer you to a terrific place (usually with coupons), or ask them about an attraction and they book reservations for you. The pool is delightful. The location can't be beat - walk or ride a bike everywhere on the island (and I am someone in his 40s who who doesn't usually ride a bike). Admittedly, the (Free) breakfast is not a gourmet spread and rooms are small and without TVs or phones (my wife and I considered the lack of these a plus, however). If you consider impersonal, cookie-cutter chain hotels a slice of heaven and demand constant cable TV and internet access, then you might think about staying elsewhere, but if you really want the Key West experience (complete cats on-site with free-range roosters in the neighborhood) and have any kind of budget, I can't imagine finding a friendlier, cleaner, more relaxing place in Old Town - unless of course want to to pay much, much more for a room.
reviews.title: What a Bargain
Great!
reviews.text: This place was quaint and in the center of everything. It was VERY clean. The breakfast was minimal but enough to get your day started - coffee, boiled eggs, fruit, bagels, cream cheese, butter, YUMMY sticky buns, juice, jam, oatmeal, hot water.
We stayed in one of the shared bathroom rooms. They kept it clean.
reviews.title: A lovely guesthouse in quaint Key West...

reviews.text: The rooms are small BUT we weren't there to do anything but sleep and get our day started.
reviews.title: Angelina was fun

reviews.text: The staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!!
